intro: Eudoxia pendula, commonly known as the hanging eudoxia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its pendulous inflorescences. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red and purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Eudoxia pendula is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
